ports.name: FTP Data Transfer
ports.use_case: File Transfer Protocol (FTP) data transfer

ports.name: FTP Control
ports.use_case: File Transfer Protocol (FTP) control commands

ports.name: SSH
ports.use_case: Secure Shell (SSH) for secure remote login

ports.name: Telnet
ports.use_case: Telnet for unencrypted remote login

ports.name: SMTP
ports.use_case: Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) for email transmission

ports.name: DNS
ports.use_case: Domain Name System (DNS) for resolving domain names to IP addresses

ports.name: HTTP
ports.use_case: Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) for web traffic

ports.name: POP3
ports.use_case: Post Office Protocol version 3 (POP3) for retrieving email from servers

ports.name: IMAP
ports.use_case: Internet Message Access Protocol (IMAP) for retrieving and managing emails

ports.name: HTTPS
ports.use_case: Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS) for encrypted web traffic

ports.name: SMB
ports.use_case: Server Message Block (SMB) for file and printer sharing

ports.name: RDP
ports.use_case: Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) for remote desktop access

ports.name: HTTP Alternate
ports.use_case: Alternative port for HTTP traffic, commonly used by proxy servers and web services

ports.name: MySQL
ports.use_case: MySQL database server communication

ports.name: PostgreSQL
ports.use_case: PostgreSQL database server communication

ports.name: Redis
ports.use_case: Redis in-memory data store communication

ports.name: MongoDB
ports.use_case: MongoDB NoSQL database server communication

ports.name: Flask Development Server
ports.use_case: Default port for the Flask web application framework (used during development)

ports.name: Custom Services
ports.use_case: Custom applications or services that require dynamic port usage

ports.name: SNMP
ports.use_case: Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) for network monitoring and management

ports.name: SNMP Trap
ports.use_case: Used by SNMP for sending notifications and traps to network management systems
